intro: Kickxia nubica, commonly known as the mountain flax, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats and sorrels. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly rough texture. Kickxia nubica is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to thrive in high-altitude environments.
